info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN RABUN...SOUTHEASTERN MACON...SOUTHWESTERN TRANSYLVANIA...SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON AND NORTH CENTRAL OCONEE COUNTIES UNTIL 715 PM EDT... At 650 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rainfall 14 miles northeast of Clayton, or near Highlands, moving northeast at 30 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Highlands, Cashiers, Lake Toxaway, Gorges State Park, Lake Glenville, Scaly Mountain, Sapphire, Bad Creek, Wolf Mountain and Pine Mountain. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
